quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 14 Quiz 5
quiz.subtitle: 14.5: Determinants of 2x2 and 3x3 Matrices
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Calculating the scalar value of a square matrix

questions.question: What is the determinant of the matrix $\begin{bmatrix} 5 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$?
Which symbol is commonly used to denote the determinant of matrix $A$?
questions.explanation: The vertical bars $|A|$ or $\text{det}(A)$ are the standard notations for the determinant.

questions.question: When using expansion by minors for a $3 \times 3$ matrix, what is the sign associated with the element in the first row, second column ($a_{12}$)?
options: It depends on the value of the element
questions.explanation: The sign pattern for a $3 \times 3$ matrix starts with positive in the top-left and alternates: $+ - +$, $- + -$, $+ - +$.

questions.question: Calculate the determinant of $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 5 & 6 & 7 \end{bmatrix}$ by expanding along the first row.
What happens to the determinant if a matrix has a row of all zeros?
questions.explanation: Expanding along a row of zeros will always result in a sum of zero, making the matrix singular.

questions.question: For a $3 \times 3$ matrix, the 'Rule of Sarrus' involves rewriting which columns to the right of the matrix?
questions.explanation: The Rule of Sarrus is a shortcut for $3 \times 3$ determinants where you repeat the first two columns to help calculate diagonal products.

questions.question: If $\text{det}(A) = 15$, what is the determinant of the matrix formed by swapping Row 1 and Row 2 of $A$?
questions.explanation: Swapping any two rows (or columns) of a matrix multiplies the determinant by $-1$.

questions.question: In the expansion of a $3 \times 3$ determinant, how many $2 \times 2$ determinants are calculated?
questions.explanation: To find a $3 \times 3$ determinant using expansion by minors, you sum three products, each involving a $2 \times 2$ determinant.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You are proficient in calculating determinants of various sizes.
scoreMessages.70: Good work. Watch your signs, especially when expanding $3 \times 3$ matrices.
scoreMessages.50: Practice the $ad - bc$ formula for $2 \times 2$ matrices to build speed.
